author: timbeiko
content:
TL;DR of the decisions made in ACD today:

Re: JSON RPC, for `eth_call` we'll be going with the approach proposed in the PR linked above by Martin. For `effectiveGasPrice`, we'll be adding it to the transaction receipt as per https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/pull/206. For the priorityFee, we'll be going with <@!202397237962211328>'s `feeHistory` proposal (https://gist.github.com/zsfelfoldi/473e29106d38525de6b4413e2ebcddf1), but capping the maximum number of blocks for which we return data to accommodate light clients. 

For London, we've agreed on these testnet blocks: 
- Ropsten: `10499401`
- Goerli: `5062605` 
- Rinkeby: `8897988` 

Also, we discussed EIP-3607 (https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/pull/3607) which adds a clarification to how transactions are validated. Because this only requires a soft fork vs. a hard fork, clients can implement it when they feel is best for them. Before that, we will just run a full sync with this change to make sure there have never cases breaking this on mainnet. <@!360491619402776577> will open up a PR against the YP with these changes.

author: zsfelfoldi
content: An important thing to clarify in the spec: reward is a 2d array with the outer array corresponding to block numbers and the inner to percentile data points. Now if the block has zero txs the inner array is not created but left null since there's no data to choose from. Is this good or should it add a (0, 0, 0) row and let the caller check that gasUsedRatio is greater than zero? Can the irregular 2d array be a problem somewhere?

author: sky.cactus
content: I would *much* rather an array of null values than a null array.

author: sky.cactus
content: "The 10th percentile is null" vs "I don't know what a percentile is"

author: sky.cactus
content: Generally speaking, having collections always exist and be non-null is notably easier to handle in most cases than having a missing collection.

author: zsfelfoldi
content: Ok, i guess you need to check the gasUsedRatio anyway to decide whether the reward data points are meaningful to you. So i'll specify adding all zero rows in this case.
